resources.name: Pennsylvania Department of Military and Veterans Affairs (DMVA)
resources.address: Building 0-47, Fort Indiantown Gap, Annville, PA 17003-5002
resources.description: State agency providing quality care for aging and disabled veterans, administering benefits programs and veterans services across all 67 Pennsylvania counties

resources.name: PA 211 - Resource and Referral Service
resources.description: Free and confidential referral service providing 24/7 access to crisis counseling, food, healthcare, housing, employment, and veteran services

resources.name: Veterans Leadership Program of Western PA
resources.description: Non-profit serving 8,000+ veterans annually across 30 counties in PA, NY, and OH. Provides comprehensive support for housing, career development, wellness, and mental health services since 1982.

resources.name: Veterans Leadership Program - Johnstown Office
resources.description: Regional office of Veterans Leadership Program providing housing, career development, wellness and mental health services

resources.name: Veterans Leadership Program - Erie Office
resources.description: Regional office of Veterans Leadership Program providing housing, career development, wellness and mental health services

resources.name: Veterans Multi-Service Center (VMC)
resources.description: Comprehensive multi-service center providing employment, housing, education, and benefits support for veterans in Philadelphia

resources.name: YWCA of Greater Harrisburg - Veterans Services
resources.description: YWCA providing comprehensive veteran support including employment readiness, housing assistance, and preventive services for homelessness across South Central PA counties

resources.name: Capital Area Coalition on Homelessness - Veterans Services
resources.address: 10 North Second Street, Suite 405, Harrisburg, PA 17105-2157
resources.description: Coalition focused on preventing and reducing homelessness in the Capital region with dedicated veterans programs including Robert M. Jackson Veterans Center and VALOR housing projects

resources.name: Robert M. Jackson Veterans Center (CACH)
resources.description: Veterans-specific facility providing comprehensive services and support under Capital Area Coalition on Homelessness

resources.name: Shalom House Veterans Housing (CACH)
resources.description: Transitional and supportive housing facility for veterans under Capital Area Coalition on Homelessness

resources.name: Housing Authority of the City of Pittsburgh - Veterans Program
resources.description: Municipal housing authority providing HUD-VASH program and affordable housing assistance for veterans and their families

resources.name: Project Journey Women Veterans Only
resources.description: Specialized program providing immediate shelter and intensive case management for women veterans for 30-90 days

resources.name: VA Philadelphia Health Care System - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.description: Federal Veterans Affairs facility providing housing support, employment training, legal navigation, mental health treatment, and healthcare for homeless veterans

resources.name: Veterans Multi-Service Center Women Veterans Center
resources.description: Specialized center for women veterans offering employment, housing, education, and benefits support

resources.name: The Steven A. Cohen Military Family Clinic
resources.description: High-quality mental health care facility providing free counseling services at no cost with no long wait times for military members and families

resources.name: Restore Valor Project
resources.description: Alternative counseling and trauma-focused treatment for combat PTSD and service-related trauma

resources.name: Menergy.org
resources.description: Therapy services specializing in intimate partner violence and harmful behavior issues for military members

resources.name: The Veterans Group
resources.description: Community organization providing basic needs assistance, education, and employment training for veterans

resources.name: Delaware Valley Veterans Home
resources.description: Residential care facility providing clinical and social support services for veterans

resources.name: Ahari Homes
resources.description: Non-profit providing permanent and supportive housing for homeless veterans and families

resources.name: Veterans Outreach of Pennsylvania
resources.description: Statewide organization providing comprehensive support including housing, healthcare, employment, legal services, mental health, and substance abuse treatment

resources.name: Stop Soldier Suicide
resources.description: Veteran-founded and veteran-led organization providing personalized mental health care and case management for suicide prevention

resources.name: Pennsylvania Wounded Warriors, Inc.
resources.description: Non-profit providing emergency financial assistance for wounded warriors with housing, utilities, and medical expenses

resources.name: Disabled Veterans of America (DAV)
resources.description: National organization providing free assistance filing disability claims and accessing veteran benefits

resources.name: Boots to Health Foundation
resources.description: Non-profit providing free fitness training, nutrition coaching, and spiritual counseling for wellness

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7/365 crisis support for active service members and veterans, also available via text at 838255

resources.name: Military OneSource
resources.description: Confidential counseling and financial guidance service for service members and families available 24/7 with online chat

resources.name: In Transition
resources.description: Free coaching and mental health provider assistance for all military members

resources.name: T*A*P*S* (Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors)
resources.description: 24/7 peer support program for families grieving fallen service members

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Free 24/7 service connecting homeless veterans or veterans at-risk for homelessness to trained counselors and resources

resources.name: Pennsylvania Department of Drug and Alcohol Programs
resources.description: State service providing treatment referrals for alcohol and drug addiction

resources.name: Greater Philadelphia Region of Narcotics Anonymous
resources.description: Peer-led recovery meetings for substance abuse with meeting locations throughout the region
